chapter.title: How to use the Maven archetype to create an OpenEngSB tool connector
chapter.para: This section describes how a new OpenEngSB tool connector can be created using a Maven archetype. For more information about tool connectors see section "Internal OpenEngSB Tool Connectors".

section.title: Using the archetype
section.para:
The following command is used to start the project generation:
mvn archetype:generate -DarchetypeCatalog="http://maven.openengsb.org/archetypes/"
The archetype named connector-archetype should show up in the archetype list. Select the archetype connector-archetype. Maven will ask if the default values for the properties shall be used. Type 'n' to overwrite the default values. The following properties are needed to generate a connector project:
artifactId: The artifactId of the generated wrapper project for the service-engine and the service-unit. groupId: The groupId of the generated wrapper project. Should be org.openengsb. version: The version of the generated wrapper project. se-artifactId: The artifactId of the service-engine. su-artifactId: The artifactId of the service-unit. description: The description of the tool connector. namespace: The namespace of the tool connector. package: The package for the source code of the service-engine. connector-name: The connector name. This is used as prefix for Java classes so it should start with a upper-case letter. domain-package: The package where the domain interface can be found which is implemented by this tool connector. domain-name: The interface name of the domain interface that is implemented by this tool connector. urn: The URN that will be used to address this tool connector.
If all these properties have been set Maven will generate the service-engine and the service-unit for the tool connector.

section.title: Structure of the connector service-engine

para.programlisting: service-engine | --------------- | | pom.xml src | main | ----------------- | | java resources | | <package> contextProperties.xml | --------------------------------------------- | | <connector-name>Endpoint.java <connector-name>Component.java

section.para: The service-engine contains a stub of the connector endpoint and a simple implementation of the connector component as well as an empty contextProperties descriptor. The pom.xml file contains the necessary setup and all dependencies needed by an OpenEngSB tool connector service-engine.

section.title: Structure of the connector service-unit

para.programlisting: service-unit | --------------- | | pom.xml src | main | resources | xbean.xml

section.para: The service-unit contains a fully configured xbean.xml file that provides the setup for an OpenEngSB tool connector service-unit. The pom.xml file contains the necessary dependency to the service-engine.

section.title: Additional steps to integrate the newly created tool connector into the OpenEngSB project
section.para:
To integrate the created tool connector the following steps have to be performed after the archetype was used to generate the service-engine and the service-unit.
Copy: The service-engine and the service-unit have to be copied to the right folder, which is starting from the OpenEngSB root folder /domains/domain-name/connector-name where domain-name and connector-name should be replaced by the respective names for the current tool connector. Parent pom.xml: Add the service engine and the service unit in the modules section and add the dependencies to the service-engine and the service-unit to the dependencyManagement section. Service-engine pom.xml: Correct the link to the parent pom.xml. (groupId, artifactId, version and relativePath). Service-unit pom.xml: Correct the link to the parent pom.xml. (groupId, artifactId, version and relativePath). Packaging: Add the dependency to the service-unit to the package-all service assembly's pom.xml to add the tool connector to this service assembly.
